channel.title: Brightest Comet ever recorded in forty years
channel.description:
On August 7, 2006 the brightest comet ever recorded was discovered by Robert H. McNaught, it is now known Comet McNaught for obvious reasons but for your convenience we'll be calling him [i]"Mr Comet"[/i] for the duration of this thread :). Anyways [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perihelion]for no reason thats easy to explain[/url] on January 12, 2007 it became visible to the naked eye to members of the southern hemisphere, so i went off to see the comet and heres the image.
[img]http://www.zyroxic.com/wiki/images/thumb/a/a3/KTHXBAI_MR_COMET.jpg/400px-KTHXBAI_MR_COMET.jpg[/img]
And here are some much better profession images...
[img]http://img174.imageshack.us/img174/5211/cometmcnaught8qt.png[/img]
Well if you want to see [i]"Mr Comet"[/i] he'll be around Venus for those of you that live in the southern hemisphere. I would see it because it's brighter than Haley's Comet and you probably won't see anything else like it in your life time.
[b][u]For more information contact your local:[/u][/b]
[ul][li][url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comet_McNaught]wikipedia[/url][/li] [li]Librarian[/li] [li]Marluxia?[/li][/ul]

@marluxia wrote:

On August 7, 2006 the brightest comet ever recorded was discovered by Robert H. McNaught, it is now known Comet McNaught for obvious reasons but for your convenience we’ll be calling him “Mr Comet” for the duration of this thread :). Anyways for no reason thats easy to explain on January 12, 2007 it became visible to the naked eye to members of the southern hemisphere, so i went off to see the comet and heres the image.

And here are some much better profession images…

Well if you want to see “Mr Comet” he’ll be around Venus for those of you that live in the southern hemisphere. I would see it because it’s brighter than Haley’s Comet and you probably won’t see anything else like it in your life time.
